analytic.title: THE AVTHOR his French Preface, thus Englished.

monogr.title: The auncient order, societie, and unitie laudable, of Prince Arthure, and his knightly armory of the Round Table : With a threefold assertion frendly in fauour and furtherance of English archery at this day. Translated and collected by R.R

div.head: THE AVTHOR his French Preface, thus Englished.
div.p: WIlling I am to set down (for the beginning of this TREATICE) a briefe declaration and aduertisement vnto the READERS, for their more easy vnderstanding of the state and Condition of ARMORY: And to knowe howe one ought to Blason the sayde ARMORIES, Escuchons and Enseignes, and such other things of Semblable state and manner. But first of all, wee will speake and treate of him or them, who first founde out and inuented the deuyse of ARMES, and for what cause the same was done.

q.p: The Glory of the Rich, Of the Honorable, and of the Pore, is the feare of God.
